Title: New Aussie music platform aims to help creatives make money from their work
Author: 9News
Content: A Perth tech company is working to revolutionise the music industry with a platform it hopes will give Spotify a run for its money. MyPremo, which has the backing of global rap star Ice Cube, helps artists better monetise their work. Sebastian Jamze dreams of being a full-time musician. READ MORE: Relief after bodybuilder who murdered mum in front of her children jailed The 19 year-old's career took off after winning a reality TV singing competition. But he says the income from his music isn't sustainable, as streaming giants like Spotify take most of the revenue from his work. "You're putting so much of your heart and soul into your song, mixing, mastering. You're putting so much money into your music, and then you're not getting anything back from what you've made," Jamze said. And he's not alone - many say the industry is broken. A Perth company now hoping to change the game and save the music industry. Cody McDowell and co-founder James Gillies have started website - MyPremo - a subscription free service - where musicians can sell their work directly to fans. READ MORE: What is clear-air turbulence and can pilots avoid it?﻿ MyPremo aims to put the power back into creators' hands, allowing them to have control of their content and revenue. "A lot of musicians aren't making money, it's very publicly known, from the Snoop Doggs of the world telling everyone they are making $45,000 from a billion streams to the small local artists who are on the pub circuit making no money," McDowell said. "We're trying to throw a lifeline out to Australian artists and help give them some money to put food on the table." Creators release their songs, and set their own price per play, receiving 80 per cent of the total sales. "So you're not relying on thousands of streams to make 0.003 of a dollar, you'll make 80 per cent of that revenue from us," Gillies said. Currently in Australia, artists have to get more than 1000 streams per song a year on Spotify to make any money at all. A total of 1500 including filmmakers and influencers from around the world are already on board. American rapper Ice Cube is a part owner of the platform. READ MORE: Former soldier charged with spying for China found dead Jamez has already had more than 25 million plays on Youtube - but he hasn't received a cent. If he released a song on iTunes he'd be lucky to get $150, whereas on MyPremo, he earned $6500 from one song. "I think it's a really incredible opportunity for artists," he said. "Having an income for what you are doing would be an absolute dream." FOLLOW US ON WHATSAPP HERE: Stay across all the latest in breaking news, celebrity and sport via our WhatsApp channel. No comments, no algorithm and nobody can see your private details.

Title: Element Health & Wellness Centre: Perth opens advanced high-tech skin treatments in Claremont
Author: Kayla Sellwood, Kayla Sellwoodper
Content: The West Australian Perth Now Click to open navigation ‌‌ News Chevron Down Icon Breaking News Western Australia National World Technology Opinion Weather Sport Chevron Down Icon AFL Cricket Soccer Basketball Tennis NRL Rugby Motor Racing MMA Golf Netball Cycling Entertainment Chevron Down Icon Confidential Movies Best Short Film Television Music Reviews Books Competitions Business Chevron Down Icon Breaking News Economy Markets Property Commercial Property Workplace Matters Lifestyle Chevron Down Icon Food Personal Finance Health Parenting Fashion Travel Home & Garden Relationships Stars Real Estate HUH? Local News Chevron Down Icon North Central South Mandurah Competitions Find My Paper Digital Editions Shop Now Read your local paperNews to your inbox Breaking News Western Australia National World Technology Opinion Weather Camera IconA new clinic has opened its doors in Perth offering high-tech treatments to improve health and well-being. Credit: Supplied Element Health & Wellness Centre: Perth opens advanced high-tech skin treatments in Claremont Kayla SellwoodPerthNow May 22, 2024 7:45PM Comments TopicsWA NewsHealthLifestyle A new clinic has opened its doors in Claremont offering high-tech treatments to improve health and well-being. Element Health Optimisation Centre is a new health and wellness clinic home to six revolutionary treatments. The treatments include an Australian first — the Theta Chamber — along with an Infrared Sauna Cocoon, Red Light Therapy, Cryotherapy, a Hyperbaric Oxygen Chamber, and soon-to-arrive Hydrogen Inhalation Therapy. Camera IconThe Infrared Sauna Cocoon at Element. Credit: Supplied TheNightly Get in front of tomorrow's news for FREE Journalism for the curious Australian across politics, business, culture and opinion.READ NOWCamera IconThe Hyperbaric Chamber at Element. Credit: Supplied The treatments aim to assist with concerns and disorders such as anxiety, panic attacks, depression, anger, addictions, drugs, alcohol, migraines, PTSD and much more. Married owners Brett and Maya Horth dedicated the past five years to researching and studying alternative methods to traditional medicine in their pursuit of providing their two children with the best quality of life. Aligning with physicians in the United States, Maya explained they have discovered profound ways to improve health and well-being. “We as a family have struggled with health issues such as fatigue, joint pain, mould issues, Lyme disease, and other concerns - with little improvement from traditional methods,” Maya said. The dynamic duo has found that their Australia-first treatment, The Theta Chamber, is a favourite among clients, who experience instant improvements such as calmness, better emotional regulation, a clearer state of mind, and more.Camera IconThe Theta Chamber at Element. Credit: Supplied Camera IconRed Light Therapy at Element. Credit: SuppliedCamera IconCryotherapy at Element. Credit: Supplied “Theta is the state of relaxation we all know as that drowsy, abstract sensation we feel as we’re falling asleep,” Maya said. “This allows the brain to take the majority of its focus off of sensory perception and conscious thought and to withdraw into the more profound regions of mental activity that we now know as the bio-magnetic field. In this state, ‘reprogramming’ or ‘remapping’ can be achieved.” For more information or to make a booking, visit the website here. Title: Crown Perth to become home ground of AC Milan ahead of clash with AS Roma on May 31
Author: Artemisia Blythe, Artemisia Blytheperth
Content: The West Australian Perth Now Click to open navigation ‌‌ News Chevron Down Icon Breaking News Western Australia National World Technology Opinion Weather Sport Chevron Down Icon AFL Cricket Soccer Basketball Tennis NRL Rugby Motor Racing MMA Golf Netball Cycling Entertainment Chevron Down Icon Confidential Movies Best Short Film Television Music Reviews Books Competitions Business Chevron Down Icon Breaking News Economy Markets Property Commercial Property Workplace Matters Lifestyle Chevron Down Icon Food Personal Finance Health Parenting Fashion Travel Home & Garden Relationships Stars Real Estate HUH? Local News Chevron Down Icon North Central South Mandurah Competitions Find My Paper Digital Editions Shop Now Read your local paperNews to your inbox AFL Cricket Soccer Basketball Tennis NRL Rugby Motor Racing MMA Golf Netball Cycling Camera IconSoccer fans are rejoicing over the AC Milan v AS Roma game coming to Perth this week. Credit: Supplied Crown Perth to become home ground of AC Milan ahead of clash with AS Roma on May 31 Artemisia BlythePerthNow May 22, 2024 7:18PM Comments TopicsSoccerSport Fans of the world game are rejoicing over the AC Milan v AS Roma clash to be held in Perth next week. For the first time, Australia will host an exclusive match between two of Italy’s most iconic football teams at Optus Stadium on Friday May 31. Perth will play home to some of the world’s most renowned players, including for the once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to witness the clash of Italian titans in Australia. Crown Perth is inviting fans to celebrate with them as they become the home of AC Milan pre-match fun from Monday, 27 May. TheNightly Get in front of tomorrow's news for FREE Journalism for the curious Australian across politics, business, culture and opinion.READ NOWCamera IconRuben Loftus-Cheek has enjoyed a strong debut season with AC Milan. Credit: Claudio Villa/AC Milan/AC Milan via Getty ImagesCamera IconCrown Perth's The Merrywell. Credit: SHOT BY THOM The Merrywell will be fully dressed in the rossoneri theme, and for soccer fanatics, on May 31 from 12 pm, the bar & bistro will host a Q & A with team legends hosted by Dave Berrie. A fan march to Optus Stadium’s official AC Milan Fan Club will follow at 4pm. SoccerRodwell among five Sydney FC departures In addition to game day proceedings, Crown Perth is giving away ‘The Ultimate Fan Pass’. The winner will receive a one-night stay in a one-bedroom Premium King at Crown Towers Perth and 2x Golden Circle access passes to an AC Milan and Roma Match open training session at HBF Park on May 30. They will also win 2 x Locker Room tickets on game day, including a “pitch walk” for two at Optus. This is a once-in-a-lifetime experience to feel the classic European football atmosphere. Tickets to the game can be purchased on the Optus stadium website. Share to Facebook Share to Twitter Email Us Copy the Link Register and have your say. Register to comment Already have an account? Title: The Vampire’s Wife: One of Princess Catherine’s favourite fashion brands is to cease trading this week
Author: Bang Showbizmay
Content: The West Australian Perth Now Click to open navigation ‌‌ News Chevron Down Icon Breaking News Western Australia National World Technology Opinion Weather Sport Chevron Down Icon AFL Cricket Soccer Basketball Tennis NRL Rugby Motor Racing MMA Golf Netball Cycling Entertainment Chevron Down Icon Confidential Movies Best Short Film Television Music Reviews Books Competitions Business Chevron Down Icon Breaking News Economy Markets Property Commercial Property Workplace Matters Lifestyle Chevron Down Icon Food Personal Finance Health Parenting Fashion Travel Home & Garden Relationships Stars Real Estate HUH? Local News Chevron Down Icon North Central South Mandurah Competitions Find My Paper Digital Editions Shop Now Read your local paperNews to your inbox Breaking News Western Australia National World Technology Opinion Weather Camera IconThere has been a major blow for Princess of Wales Kate Middleton on the back of news she won’t be returning to work anytime soon. Credit: Supplied The Vampire’s Wife: One of Princess Catherine’s favourite fashion brands is to cease trading this week Bang Showbiz May 22, 2024 6:45PM Comments TopicsKate MiddletonRoyal Family The Vampire’s Wife will cease trading this week. The Gothic luxury fashion brand — whose famous wearers include Catherine, Princess of Wales — is owned by former model Susie Cave, the wife of singer Nick Cave. However, it’s been hit hard by issues in the wholesale market and financial woes, including a battle with HMRC over taxes. Fans will have one last chance to purchase their products from May 24 to 26 at The Music Room in London’s Mayfair. ‘Excited’Palace gives update on Princess Kate’s condition WATCH THE VIDEOPrince William overheard giving update on Kate’s health TheNightly Get in front of tomorrow's news for FREE Journalism for the curious Australian across politics, business, culture and opinion.READ NOW In a social media statement, Susie said: “After ten years as The Creative Director of The Vampire’s Wife, it is time for me to say goodbye. I say this with great sadness and want to express my undying gratitude to you all for your support. “I wish to thank my extended family at The Vampire’s Wife, who helped me create such beautiful things. I cannot describe how much you have all meant to me. “I love you all, Susie.” Music mogul Jimmy Iovine and his wife, supermodel and entrepreneur Liberty Ross, were among the firm’s investors. In its statement, The Vampire’s Wife said: “Despite a period of positive growth and sales, the upheaval in the wholesale market had dramatic implications for the brand. The Vampire’s Wife, therefore, announces that it has sadly made the decision to cease trading with immediate effect.” Princess Catherine famously wowed in the brand’s signature Falconetti mid-length gown in her first official joint portrait with her husband, William, Prince of Wales. Title: IPL 2024: ‘What RCB have done has been absolutely phenomenal’, says Sunil Gavaskar
Author: India News Newsdesk
Content: New Delhi, May 22 (IANS) Former Indian cricketer Sunil Gavaskar heaped praise on Royal Challengers Bengaluru’s (RCB) performance in the second half of the Indian Premier League (IPL) 2024 as “absolutely phenomenal”. After reeling at the bottom of the table in the first half of the tournament, RCB made a sensational comeback as they won their last six matches to finish their league stage campaign in the final four with 14 points. In their first eight games, they only won a single game against Punjab Kings. It’s the fourth time RCB entered the IPL playoffs in the last five seasons. Yash Dayal starred with 2-42, including taking out MS Dhoni in a seven-run final over, as RCB held their nerve to enter the IPL 2024 playoffs with a stunning 27-run win over Chennai Super Kings at the M. Chinnaswamy Stadium to play Eliminator on Wednesday against Rajasthan Royals. “What RCB have done has been absolutely phenomenal. Nothing short of phenomenal. Firstly, to believe that they can bounce back takes something special. The leading players there, Faf du Plessis, Virat Kohli, and other senior players, must be the ones most encouraging to the other team members. Other team members can quickly get into a situation where they might feel we’ve lost everything,” said Gavaskar on Star Sports Cricket Live. “It’s up to the seniors, and I think they have done their job. They have done it by showing them how. Faf and Virat have played extraordinary cricket. Rajasthan, on the other hand, have lost their last four or five matches, and they didn’t play well in their last game. So they’ve been out of practice. “Now, unless they do something special like KKR did today, despite not playing for 11 days, it could turn out to be another one-sided game tomorrow. My fear is that it will be another one-sided game where RCB, who are playing just absolutely phenomenal cricket, will walk all over RR,” he added. Rajasthan Royals (RR) finished third in the standings with 17 points and a net run rate of +0.273. They won eight out of their 14 group matches with the last one getting washed out. With a win in the Eliminator, the team can proceed to Qualifier 2, where they will meet the loser of Qualifier 1 for a place in the final. Meanwhile, former England cricketer Kevin Pietersen shared his thoughts on the eliminator match between RCB and RR, said, “RCB is playing cricket as well as they’ve ever played. They’ve got themselves to a situation where momentum is all in their favour. They’ve got bowlers bowling well, batters batting brilliantly, and Faf du Plessis leading them as well as he’s ever led a team. So, I find it very, very hard to think that Rajasthan are going to put up a fight tomorrow.” “They’ve lost Jos Buttler, and Jos Buttler is such a big player. When you open with Yashasvi Jaiswal, and you know that he looks up to Jos so much, it is such a big loss. It’s actually quite sad that the England players have had to leave this tournament and they’re not here on the bigger stage. “I’m sure the players would love to be playing here on the bigger stage in Ahmedabad and then off to Chennai to play the finals. This tournament deserves that, and it’s just unfortunate that some of the biggest players in the world are not going to be here,” Pietersen added. The fight for Qualifier 2 will be tough as RCB, who have the momentum with them after winning six games in a row will face Royals, who are coming after four consecutive loss. –IANS hs/bc
